verses.verse: And it came to pass in the eleventh<WH6249> <WH6240> year<WH8141>, in the first<WH259> day of the month<WH2320>, that the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> came unto me, saying<WH559>,

Son<WH1121> of man<WH120>, because that Tyrus<WH6865> hath said<WH559> against Jerusalem<WH3389>, Aha<WH1889>, she is broken<WH7665> that was the gates<WH1817> of the people<WH5971>: she is turned<WH5437> unto me: I shall be replenished<WH4390>, now she is laid waste<WH2717>:

Therefore thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>; Behold, I am against thee, O Tyrus<WH6865>, and will cause many<WH7227> nations<WH1471> to come up<WH5927> against thee, as the sea<WH3220> causeth his waves<WH1530> to come up<WH5927>.

And they shall destroy<WH7843> the walls<WH2346> of Tyrus<WH6865>, and break down<WH2040> her towers<WH4026>: I will also scrape<WH5500> her dust<WH6083> from her, and make<WH5414> her like the top<WH6706> of a rock<WH5553>.

It shall be a place for the spreading<WH4894> of nets<WH2764> in the midst<WH8432> of the sea<WH3220>: for I have spoken<WH1696> it, saith<WH5002> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>: and it shall become a spoil<WH957> to the nations<WH1471>.
And her daughters<WH1323> which are in the field<WH7704> shall be slain<WH2026> by the sword<WH2719>; and they shall know<WH3045> that I am the LORD<WH3068>.

For thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>; Behold, I will bring<WH935> upon Tyrus<WH6865> Nebuchadrezzar<WH5019> king<WH4428> of Babylon<WH894>, a king<WH4428> of kings<WH4428>, from the north<WH6828>, with horses<WH5483>, and with chariots<WH7393>, and with horsemen<WH6571>, and companies<WH6951>, and much<WH7227> people<WH5971>.

He shall slay<WH2026> with the sword<WH2719> thy daughters<WH1323> in the field<WH7704>: and he shall make<WH5414> a fort<WH1785> against thee, and cast<WH8210> a mount<WH5550> against thee, and lift up<WH6965> the buckler<WH6793> against thee. cast: or, pour out the engine of shot
And he shall set<WH5414> engines<WH4239> of war<WH6904> against thy walls<WH2346>, and with his axes<WH2719> he shall break down<WH5422> thy towers<WH4026>.

By reason of the abundance<WH8229> of his horses<WH5483> their dust<WH80> shall cover<WH3680> thee: thy walls<WH2346> shall shake<WH7493> at the noise<WH6963> of the horsemen<WH6571>, and of the wheels<WH1534>, and of the chariots<WH7393>, when he shall enter<WH935> into thy gates<WH8179>, as men enter<WH3996> into a city<WH5892> wherein is made a breach<WH1234>. as men: Heb. according to the enterings of a city broken up

With the hoofs<WH6541> of his horses<WH5483> shall he tread down<WH7429> all thy streets<WH2351>: he shall slay<WH2026> thy people<WH5971> by the sword<WH2719>, and thy strong<WH5797> garrisons<WH4676> shall go down<WH3381> to the ground<WH776>.

And they shall make a spoil<WH7997> of thy riches<WH2428>, and make a prey<WH962> of thy merchandise<WH7404>: and they shall break down<WH2040> thy walls<WH2346>, and destroy<WH5422> thy pleasant<WH2532> houses<WH1004>: and they shall lay<WH7760> thy stones<WH68> and thy timber<WH6086> and thy dust<WH6083> in the midst<WH8432> of the water<WH4325>. thy pleasant: Heb. houses of thy desire
And I will cause the noise<WH1995> of thy songs<WH7892> to cease<WH7673>; and the sound<WH6963> of thy harps<WH3658> shall be no more heard<WH8085>.

And I will make<WH5414> thee like the top<WH6706> of a rock<WH5553>: thou shalt be a place to spread<WH4894> nets<WH2764> upon<WH4894>; thou shalt be built<WH1129> no more: for I the LORD<WH3068> have spoken<WH1696> it, saith<WH5002> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>.

Thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069> to Tyrus<WH6865>; Shall not the isles<WH339> shake<WH7493> at the sound<WH6963> of thy fall<WH4658>, when the wounded<WH2491> cry<WH602>, when the slaughter<WH2027> is made<WH2026> in the midst<WH8432> of thee?

Then all the princes<WH5387> of the sea<WH3220> shall come down<WH3381> from their thrones<WH3678>, and lay away<WH5493> their robes<WH4598>, and put off<WH6584> their broidered<WH7553> garments<WH899>: they shall clothe<WH3847> themselves with trembling<WH2731>; they shall sit<WH3427> upon the ground<WH776>, and shall tremble<WH2729> at every moment<WH7281>, and be astonished<WH8074> at thee. trembling: Heb. tremblings

And they shall take up<WH5375> a lamentation<WH7015> for thee, and say<WH559> to thee, How art thou destroyed<WH6>, that wast inhabited<WH3427> of seafaring men<WH3220>, the renowned<WH1984> city<WH5892>, which wast strong<WH2389> in the sea<WH3220>, she and her inhabitants<WH3427>, which cause<WH5414> their terror<WH2851> to be on all that haunt<WH3427> it! of: Heb. of the seas
Now shall the isles<WH339> tremble<WH2729> in the day<WH3117> of thy fall<WH4658>; yea, the isles<WH339> that are in the sea<WH3220> shall be troubled<WH926> at thy departure<WH3318>.

For thus saith<WH559> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>; When I shall make<WH5414> thee a desolate<WH2717> city<WH5892>, like the cities<WH5892> that are not inhabited<WH3427>; when I shall bring up<WH5927> the deep<WH8415> upon thee, and great<WH7227> waters<WH4325> shall cover<WH3680> thee;

When I shall bring thee down<WH3381> with them that descend<WH3381> into the pit<WH953>, with the people<WH5971> of old time<WH5769>, and shall set<WH3427> thee in the low parts<WH8482> of the earth<WH776>, in places desolate<WH2723> of old<WH5769>, with them that go down<WH3381> to the pit<WH953>, that thou be not inhabited<WH3427>; and I shall set<WH5414> glory<WH6643> in the land<WH776> of the living<WH2416>;

I will make<WH5414> thee a terror<WH1091>, and thou shalt be no more: though thou be sought for<WH1245>, yet shalt thou never<WH5769> be found<WH4672> again, saith<WH5002> the Lord<WH136> GOD<WH3069>. a terror: Heb. terrors
